page.title: 16OCCUPATIONS IN CIMLA
page.content: Children in class 4H, Crynallt Junior school carried out a survey into the occupations of 63 adults.32 males and 31 females were questioned.The results showed that of the males,7 were fitters,2 teachers,3 electricians,4 sales representatives,2 accountants,2 engineers,one shipping agent, one computer programmer,one collier,one prison officer,one lecturer,one factory manager,one store keeper,one builder,one steelworker and 3 were unemployed.Of the females,2 were cleaners,3 nurses,4 shop assistants and 4 were clerks.18 worked at home, caring for young children in their families.Few people were able to work locally, most had to travel to Neath, Port Talbot or Swansea to work. Some had to travel much greater distances to work in Bridgend,Cardiff and Newport.
